newsitem.title: USA: Wall Street seen extending gains at open.
newsitem.headline: Wall Street seen extending gains at open.

text.p: U.S. stocks were expected to push higher at the session start on Friday, adding on to Thursday's rally and supported by the growing conviction that a tobacco settlement coming soon.

"The market continues to be in strong hands, with buyers outnumbering sellers," said Alan Ackerman, a market strategist at Fahnestock & Co. He said volume would be heavy, given the expiration on Friday of index futures and options.
The Standard & Poor's futures were up 0.10 points at 907.50, off early highs. The long bond was unchanged.
